extendedInfo.description: AirSync: Sync your iTunes music & videos over WiFi & AirPlay to Apple TV. Described by the press as the "iTunes for Android". Recommended by the New York Times, Wall Street Journal and the BBC. The most user friendly way to listen to your iTunes on your Android, trusted by millions of users.â Number one app in Newsweek's Top 10 Android apps for 2011 ââ "The Cure for iTunes withdrawal" - New York Times âLife Without Wires! doubleTwist AirSyncâ¢ wirelessly syncs your iTunes music, photos and videos with your Mac or PC over your home WiFi network.Use in conjunction with the free doubleTwist desktop app to automatically import & sync your iTunes music, iTunes playlists as well as your iTunes ratings & playcounts from your Mac or PC.â¬ Securely pair your Android device with your Mac or PC.â¬ Sync and automatic, wireless import of photos and videos from your Android to your PC.â¬ Sync and automatically import MP3 purchases & downloads from your phone back to your Mac or PC.â¬ Wirelessly sync iTunes music, iTunes playlists, iTunes ratings and playcounts.â¬ Stream music, videos and photos to devices such as Xbox, PS3, Sonos, and Apple TV (black model; AirPort Express not yet supported).doubleTwist AirSync is an upgrade to the free doubleTwist Player."iTunes for Android" - use your phone as an iPod!Need help with doubleTwist? http://doubletwist.com/help/The free doubleTwist desktop app requires MacOS X 10.5 or higher on your Mac, or WinXP SP2/Vista/Windows 7 on your PC. Once you install doubleTwist on your Mac or PC, it will scan and import your iTunes and/or Windows Media Player library. It will also scan your Music folder for any additional music files.If you have comments or feedback on our app, or need additional support, please visit http://doubletwist.com/contact/. Thanks! doubleTwist Team, San FranciscoKeywords: iTunes for android and iTunes music download, iTunes music for Mac and Windows, iPod music transfer, sync mp3 files, iTunes playlist synciTunes is a registered trademark of Apple Inc.

reviews.title: My head\'s going to explode
reviews.comment: Paired and synced at first but now my desktop can\'t see my phone. Re-installed on desktop didn\'t help. Can\'t reinstall on phone. Settings menu stopped functioning on phone. Overall nightmare.   Mac osx 10.6.8 Jelly bean on galaxy note 2
reviews.author: Patrick Moore

reviews.title: Excellent app
reviews.comment: Works great, the wireless sync is seamless and the UI looks cool.
reviews.author: Hayley Vu

reviews.title: Don\'t buy...in app purchase is ridiculously priced
reviews.comment: The full functionality on this cost $9.99 MORE than what this price is.  Plus it doesn\'t really do that must for you that you can\'t already do for cheaper.  By the time you get it installed you won\'t be able to get a refund.  Disappointed...the reviews kinda sucked me in.
reviews.author: Victor Hoffman

reviews.title: Don\'t waste your money
reviews.comment: Use Motocast.  Doesn\'t work without wifi. Takes up all the memory on your phone.  Does allow you to listen to iTunes music on your phone, but the free version does that too.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not everything I hoped for.
reviews.comment: When evaluating this against another software item I chose this because it didn\'t state that DRM music was excluded.  I had to upgrade as it doesn\'t support the Samsung S3 with a USB cable.  After paying my $5 to upgrade, and after my synch was up, that\'s when I learn it didn\'t copy ~200 songs because of DRM.  Makes me wish I\'d just gone Apple instead of Droid.
reviews.author: Stephen Kemp

reviews.title: Disappointed with double twist system.
reviews.comment: Was forced to purchase this app to try double twist on my galaxy s3 since usb does not work with it. Found out that double twist does not support selecting which playlist to sync. I couldn\'t even fit every son I\'ve rated 4 or 5 stars on a 32gb card let alone my 120gb library.
reviews.author: Derwent Tredegar

reviews.title: Saved me from buying an allshare!!!
reviews.comment: Thanks this I can stream my content through my apple tv. And don\'t have to purchase the $100 allshare!!
reviews.author: Malik G

reviews.title: Buggy
reviews.comment: Airsync is very buggy. I\'ve been waiting on the promised better iTunes integration before posting judgment. Sync takes hours even when only one or two songs have been added. When syncing I cannot turn off the screen. If I hit the power button to do so the screen will flicker on and off repeatedly. I do like the functionality once it\'s done but it needs a lot of work.
reviews.author: Christopher Fitch

reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK FOR MACBOOK PRO!
reviews.comment: After unsucessfully trying to sync my HTC One via usb, I gave in and bought the air sync upgrade thinking that would solve the issue.. I was wrong. If I could give this zero stars I would.
reviews.author: shayna smith

reviews.title: Stopped working with Apple TV
reviews.comment: Update: With a little help from tech support all is working again. I have a second gen Apple TV model MC572LL/A using software version 5.3 (6105). Airplay no longer works. In fact the software no longer detects my Apple TV. The only reason I bought this software was for air play. Doesn\'t works on my Galaxy Note 2 or Nexus 7. Disappointed!
reviews.author: James Ruggiero

reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.comment: Worked great! Super user friendly! Best 5 bucks I ever spent!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: hoho soo slow
reviews.comment: this program is soooo slooow on my mac (2.4core2duo,8gb,10.81) its so slow that i cant realy use it... damn you need to fix this program!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent OTA sync solution
reviews.comment: I\'ve gotten used to rolling in double twist on my Mac and syncing to my nexus 7 and galaxy nexus at the same time. Other than being slow to transfer which is how my iPad worked and this cannot pay music while syncing, there are no other issues for this software. You\'ve come s long way double twist.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Disgusting
reviews.comment: Just not worth it... the Samsung link app does all the syncing I need and its free... not to mention no more loading... worst buy ever.
reviews.author: brandon benson

reviews.title: Just doesn\'t work
reviews.comment: Really wanted this to be the \'iTunes\' of Android but it just isn\'t. Using on both Samsung S3 and Asus TF201 and it\'s so inconsistent. \'Sync Failed\' regularly with no explanation as to why. Note also, for some utterly bizarre reason, photo sync is ONE WAY - from device to PC. Which kind of isn\'t \'synchronisation\' is it? That\'s \'copying\'. \'New version coming soon\' message has been standard for months now too - guessing it\'s been abandoned. Disappointed and not worth \302\2435.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: TERRIBLE App
reviews.comment: Brutally slow. By the time I got it going & realized how bad it was, I could no longer return it. If possible I would give this a -5 star rating; one for each dollar I threw away. SAVE YOUR MONEY!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I paid money for this?
reviews.comment: Google Play Music does everything this does, even OTA. This is ridiculous, the downloaded music doesn\'t even play smoothly.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good when it works
reviews.comment: All of a sudden it finds my phone but not the files on it so won\'t sync anymore.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I wish I could get my money back
reviews.comment: I purchased and downloaded this app and started downloading songs stored on my PC. About 30 tracks into the process the app hung with error messages oscillating between \"Downloading track nn\" and \"Do not disconnect\". After 20 minutes I pulled the plug. The player, by the way, did not allow for playing by genre, which, as a dancer, was/is paramount to me. For a meer $1.30 I suggest using WiFi Sync Pro.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: No Airport Express support
reviews.comment: I really only bought this for the AirPlay support, and unfortunately it\'s a let down. Works OK with Apple TVs but no such luck with Airport Express devices. Not really a complete solution and not really worth the money.
reviews.author: Samuel G Smith
